answers.answer: Since all u did was protected sex and oral u don't realistically have any risk of HIV, but maybe u have herpes which can cause shingles along with a few other things
Its already confirmed that I have the herpes zoster, Not genital herpes but another strain. This happens once a year, Im hoping its just a coinincidence.

from history you mentioned you don't have HIV concern,(shingles) is reactivation of the virus that cause chicken pox in childhood,and this usually happen when body immune  system decrease,so herpes zoster can happen in late stage HIV persons.but if you don't have history of unprotected anal or vaginal sex search for other causes that cause body immune decreasing like diabetes , sever anxiety....etc
i got shingles when i was 18 years old,and doctors never find the exact cause that made my body immune decreasing.

question: Hi,I never learned my lession and continued to see call girls. All covered of course but I did perform oral on them sometimes. It's been a month since I last saw someone and I have shingles (confirmed by a doctor), could this be a sign of HIV? I know protected sex is not a risk and neither is oral, but sometimes bad things happen right? Please help put my mind at ease.
title: Shingles a sign of acute HIV?
